author: Staff Reporter
text:
People from Avinashi and nearby areas tonsuring on Thursday to express solidarity to the activists who were on an indefinite fast since February 8 demanding implementation of Athikadavu-Avinashi Flood Flow Canal Scheme.

The struggle by activists for speedy implementation of the Athikadavu-Avinashi Flood Canal Scheme has received support from textile entrepreneurs on Thursday.

A meeting of various textile industry stakeholders convened by Tirupur Exporters and Manufacturers Association (TEAMA) on Thursday decided to observe a dawn-to-dusk shut down of their units on February 20.

Support

“About 700 member units of TEAMA and the units in printing, knitting and a few other segments of the production chain will stop the production to express support for the Athikadavu-Avinashi scheme,” TEAMA president M. P. Muthurathinam told reporters. He added that a section of traders would also be joining the textile unit owners in the agitation.

Agitation

Meanwhile, a group of residents from Avinashi and nearby areas tonsured to express their solidarity to the 14 people who were on an indefinite fast at Avinashi demanding speedy execution of the scheme. T. Sathyamoorthy, a lawyer-activist who were among coordinating the project, said the indefinite fast would continue till the government allocated funds for the project or issue Government Order to implement the scheme in its full.

On Thursday, one of the activists on fast had to be hospitalised as his health deteriorated.
title: Athikadavu-Avinashi scheme: textile entrepreneurs to down shutters on Feb. 20
